MAN.TITLE: scilab
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Major unix script to execute Scilab and miscellaneous tools

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: -ns
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: :if this option is present the startup file SCI/scilab.star is not executed.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: -nw
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: :if this option is present then scilab is not run in an X window.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: -f file
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : if this option is present then Scilab script file is executed first into Scilab.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: -args arguments
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : if this option is present arguments are passed to Scilab. They can then be got by sciargs function. For multi arguments passing use a quoted, blank separated sequence of words like: scilab -args 'foo1 foo2'

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: scilab -help <key>
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : write on-line documentation about <key> (usually automatically called by scilab command "help <key>"). Example:

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: scilab -k <key>
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : gives the list of Scilab commands containing the keyword <key> in their description (usually automatically called by scilab command "apropos <key>")

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: scilab -xk <key>
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : gives the list of Scilab commands containing the keyword <key> in their description in a X window.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: scilab -link <objects>
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Is used to produce a local scilex (executable code of Scilab) linked with the additional files given by the user in <objects>. If, in the list of object files, some names are known from SCIDIR/routines/default, then the scilex default files are omitted and replaced with the given ones . This command also produces a xscilab script, which when called will ran the new generated scilex file.
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: will create a new scilex file in which the default interf.o file will be replaced by C/interf.o.
